Description: A feature is presented in such a way that a web administrator can reasonably believe they are presented with all the relevant information to make an informed choice when in reality additional privacy-related risks are hidden
Default configurations set by the third party that maximize data collection
Instances where third-party documentation has explicit recommendations or best practices that maximize data collection
Language that creates the perception that a web administrator would be missing out on opportunities or not getting the full offering of a certain feature by not making data maximization decisions
Instances where third party guidance appears to be in contradiction to the underlying mechanisms of the data collection feature
